levels.title: Front End Engineer I
levels.description: A level one front end engineer is just beginning their professional career in front end software engineering and is working toward a strong foundational knowledge of the fundamentals.

levels.title: Front End Engineer II
levels.description: A level two front end engineer has relevant professional experience and a solid understanding of front end engineering fundamentals. They require less direction to accomplish tasks.

levels.title: Lead Front End Engineer
levels.description: A lead front end engineer is a highly experienced individual contributor whoʼs been given leadership responsibilities. Lead engineers generally have others reporting to them and have more input over the design and direction of our products.

levels.title: Back End Engineer I
levels.description: A level one back end engineer is just beginning their professional career in back end software engineering and is working toward a strong foundational knowledge of the fundamentals.

levels.title: Back End Engineer II
levels.description: A level two back end engineer has relevant professional experience and a solid understanding of back end engineering fundamentals. They require less direction to accomplish tasks.

levels.title: Lead Back End Engineer
levels.description: A lead back end engineer is a highly experienced individual contributor whoʼs been given leadership responsibilities. Lead engineers generally have others reporting to them and have more input over the design and direction of our products.

levels.title: UI Designer I
levels.description: A level one UI designer is just beginning their professional career in product design and is working toward developing a more complete and experienced skillset in the field.

levels.title: UI Designer II
levels.description: A level two UI designer has relevant professional experience and is well versed in designing engaging and thoughtful user interfaces for a variety of use cases.

levels.title: Lead UI Designer
levels.description: A lead UI designer is a highly experienced individual contributor whoʼs been given leadership responsibilities. Lead designers generally have others reporting to them and have more input over the design and direction of our products.

levels.title: Customer Success Champion I
levels.description: A level one customer success champion has relevant work experience in customer service oriented roles, is a strong communicator, is personable, and is tech-savvy enough to understand new technologies quickly.

levels.title: Customer Success Champion II
levels.description: A level two customer success champion has extensive work experience in customer success roles, has excellent communication skills, is very personable, and has a strong grasp of technology.

levels.title: Lead Customer Success Champion
levels.description: A lead customer success champion is as talented as a level two customer success champion, but also has leadership responsibilities. Among other things, this includes reviewing the performance of others who report to them, taking an active role in the hiring process, and ensuring team goals are achieved.
